title: ProActive
text: ProActive automatically detects regions gapped elevated read coverage using 2D pattern-matching algorithm. ProActive detects, characterizes visualizes read coverage patterns genomes metagenomes. Optionally, users may provide gene annotations associated genome metagenome form .gff file. case, ProActive generate additional output table containing gene annotations found within detected regions gapped elevated read coverage. Additionally, users can search gene annotations interest output read coverage plots. Visualizing read coverage data important gaps elevations coverage can indicators variety biological non-biological scenarios, example- Elevations gaps read coverage may caused types structural variants. Deletions can cause gaps duplications can cause elevations read coverage [1]. Highly active /abundant mobile genetic elements, like transposable elements [2] prophage [3] example, can create elevations read coverage respective integration sites. Genetic regions high mutation rates /high variability within population can generate gaps read coverage [4]. Poor quality sequencing reads chimeric reference sequences may cause gaps elevations read coverage. Since cause gaps elevations read coverage can ambiguous, ProActive best used screening method identify genetic regions investigation tools! References: Tattini L., D’Aurizio R., & Magi . (2015). Detection Genomic Structural Variants Next-Generation Sequencing Data. Frontiers bioengineering biotechnology, 3, 92. https://doi.org/10.3389/fbioe.2015.00092 Kleiner M., Bushnell B., Sanderson K.E. et al. (2020) Transductomics: sequencing-based detection analysis transduced DNA pure cultures microbial communities. Microbiome 8, 158. https://doi.org/10.1186/s40168-020-00935-5 Kieft K., Anantharaman K. (2022). Deciphering Active Prophages Metagenomes. mSystems 7:e00084-22. https://doi.org/10.1128/msystems.00084-22 Fogarty E., Moore R. (2019). Visualizing contig coverages better understand microbial population structure. https://merenlab.org/2019/11/25/visualizing-coverages/

title: ProActive
text: ProActive detects read coverage patterns using pattern-matching algorithm operates pileup files. pileup file file format row summarizes ‘pileup’ reads specific genomic locations. Pileup files can used generate rolling mean read coverages associated base pair positions reduces data size preserving read coverage patterns. ProActive requires input pileups files generated using 100 bp window/bin size. Pileup files generated using .bam files produced mapping sequencing reads metagenome genome fasta file. Read mapping performed using high minimum identity (0.97 higher) random mapping ambiguous reads. read mappers, like BBMap, allow generation pileup files bbmap.sh command use bincov output covbinsize=100 parameter/argument. Otherwise, BBMap’s pileup.sh can convert .bam files produced read mapper pileup files compatible ProActive using bincov output binsize=100. input pileup file metagenomes must following format: Dataframe four columns: V1: Contig accession V2: Mapped read coverage values averaged 100 bp windows V3: Starting position (bp) 100 bp window. Restarts 100 start new contig. V4: Starting position (bp) 100 bp window. restart start new contig. Note format genome pileup slightly different! third column (V3) restart fourth column (V4) starts 0. ProActive accounts differences pileup formats genomes metagenomes. Users may use ‘sampleMetagenomePileup’ ‘sampleGenomePileup’ files come pre-loaded ProActive references proper input file format.

title: ProActive
text: Optionally, ProActive accept .gff file additional input. .gff file must associated metagenome genome used create pileup file. .gff file TSV format follow layout described .       (Hint- using gff file output PROKKA, may need remove unnecessary (ProActive) lines text top file. various ways one can remove additional lines, however, nice command-line solution :) ‘COMMONID’ value contig genome accessions start . example, ‘COMMONID’ contig accessions sampleMetagenomegffTSV displayed “NODE” since accessions start “NODE”.

title: ProActive
text: ProActiveDetect() main function ProActive R package. function filters contigs/chunks based length read coverage, performs pattern-matching detect gaps elevations read coverage, identifies start stop positions sizes pattern-matches, , optionally, extracts gene annotations fall within detect gaps elevations read coverage.

title: ProActive
text: Currently, ProActiveDetect() can detect one gap elevation pattern per contig. ProActiveDetect() able detect multiple read coverage patterns per contig, implemented ‘chunking’ functionality (chunkContigs = TRUE) chunks large contigs smaller subsets (defined chunkSize) pattern-matching can performed chunk individual contig. chunking mechanism allows ProActiveDetect() perform pattern-matching entire genome sequences. contigs/genomes chunked, assigned sequential value link chunks back together (.e. “NODE_1_chunk_1, NODE_1_chunk_2, NODE_1_chunk_3, …). Note remaining ‘chunk’ contig/genome may long enough perform pattern-matching . Chunks small pattern-matching put output FilteredOut table. chunk splits gap elevation pattern half, ProActiveDetect() attempt detect report user ‘possible pattern-match continuity’ contig/genome chunks. Pattern-match continuity detected two sequential chunks partial elevation/gap pattern going right left side chunks, respectively.

title: ProActive
text: Contigs/chunks short little read coverage filtered prior pattern-matching. ProActiveDetect() filters contigs/chunks least 10x coverage total 5,000 bp across whole contig/chunk. read coverage filtering done way avoid filtering long contigs/chunks small elevations read coverage might get removed filtering done read coverage averages medians. Additionally, contigs/chunks less 30,000 bp filtered default, however can changed minContigLength parameter can set minimum 25,000 bp. like reduce size input metagenome pileup file ProActiveDetect(), consider pre-filtering assembly contigs greater 25,000 bp prior read mapping!

title: ProActive
text: input pileup files 100 bp windows mapped read coverage averaged . ProActiveDetect() increases window size prior pattern-matching averaging read coverages value specified windowSize. many cases, read coverage patterns don’t require resolution 100 bp windows provide, however, starting 100 bp windowSize means higher resolution available needed. users can use 100 bp windowSize ProActiveDetect(), processing time increased significantly noisy data may interfere pattern-matching. find default 1,000 bp windowSize provides nice balance processing time read coverage pattern resolution. ’d like resolution 1,000 bp windowSize provides, consider dropping windowSize 500. ’d like fine scale read coverage resolution, consider viewing contigs/genome software like Integrative Genomics Viewer IGV.

title: ProActive
text: ProActiveDetect() detects read coverage patterns using 2D pattern-matching algorithm. Several predefined patterns, described , built using specific length read coverage values contig/chunk assessed. Patterns translated across contig/chunk 1,000 bp sliding windows translation, pattern-match score calculated taking mean absolute difference read coverage pattern values. smaller match-score, better pattern-match. pattern fully translated across contig/chunk, certain aspects pattern changed (.e. height, base, width) translation repeated. process translation pattern re-scaling repeated large number pattern variations tested. pattern-matching complete, pattern associated best match-score used contig/chunk classification. Contigs/chunks classified ‘Elevation’, ‘Gap’, ‘NoPattern’ pattern-matching.

title: ProActive
text: ‘elevation’ class defined ‘block’ pattern. pattern-matching, height (max.), base (min.) width altered pattern variations translated across contig/chunk. block width never gets smaller 10,000 bp default, however can changed minSize parameter.

title: ProActive
text: ‘gap’ class essentially reverse values used build block pattern ‘elevation’ class. pattern-matching steps (alteration pattern max., min. width values pattern translation) used elevation pattern used gap pattern.

title: ProActive
text: Elevations gaps trail one side contig/chunk hard classify read coverage can interpreted gap elevation depending ’re looking . classify contigs/chunk ‘Gap’ elevated region greater 50% length contig/chunk. Conversely, elevated region less 50% contig/chunk length, classification ‘Elevation’.

title: ProActive
text: Since best pattern-match contig/chunk determined comparing match-scores amongst pattern-variations pattern classes, needed ‘negative control’ pattern compare . ‘NoPattern’ ‘pattern’ serves negative control matching contigs/chunks read coverage patterns. made two NoPattern patterns consist horizontal line length contig/chunk assessed contig/chunk’s average median read coverage value. pattern re-scaled translated way.

title: ProActive
text: Every gap elevation classification receives ‘elevation ratio’ value simply pattern-match’s maximum value divided minimum value. Elevation classifications, can think elevation ratio many times greater read coverage elevated region compare non-elevated region’. Conversely, Gap classifications, elevation ratio many times less read coverage gap region compared non-gapped region.

what: Extracting gene annotations in elevated/gapped regions
title: ProActive
text: .gff file provided, ProActiveDetect() extract gene annotations found within gapped elevated pattern-match regions provide user output table (GeneAnnotTable). additional column added classification information (Gap Elevation) associated gene annotations. input .gff file contains gene ‘product’ field attributes column (9th column dataframe), ProActiveDetect() extract product information separate column easy visualization filtering annotations interest.

title: ProActive
text: Default arguments metagenome mode: Default arguments genome mode: Note ProActiveDetect() can run without gffTSV file!
code: ProActiveOutputMetagenome <- ProActiveDetect(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   mode = "metagenome",   gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 2.03secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>         3         3         1 ProActiveOutputGenome <- ProActiveDetect(   pileup = sampleGenomePileup,   mode = "genome",   gffTSV = sampleGenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 31.21secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>        25         3        21

title: ProActive
text: pileup: .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. mode: Either “genome” “metagenome”. gffTSV: Optional, .gff file (TSV) containing gene annotations associated .fasta file used generate pileup. windowSize: number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. minSize: minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. maxSize: maximum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default NA (.e. maximum). minContigLength: minimum contig/chunk size (bp) perform pattern-matching . Default 25000. chunkSize: mode = "genome" mode = "metagenome" chunkContigs = TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching. chunkSize determines size (bp) ‘chunk’. Default 100000. chunkContigs: TRUE FALSE, TRUE mode = "metagenome", contigs longer chunkSize ‘chunked’ smaller subsets pattern-matching performed subset. Default FALSE. IncludeNoPatterns: TRUE FALSE, TRUE noPattern pattern-matches included PatternMatches output list. like visualize read coverage noPattern classifications plotProActiveResults(), set TRUE. verbose: TRUE FALSE. Print progress messages console. Default TRUE. saveFilesTo: Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results.
code: ProActiveDetect(   pileup,   mode,   gffTSV,   windowSize = 1000,   minSize = 10000,   maxSize = Inf,   minContigLength = 30000,   chunkSize = 50000,   chunkContigs = FALSE,   IncludeNoPatterns = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   saveFilesTo )

title: ProActive
text: output ProActiveDetect() list containing six objects: SummaryTable: table containing pattern-matching classifications CleanSummaryTable: table containing Gap Elevation pattern-match classifications (.e. noPattern classifications removed) PatternMatches: list object containing information needed visualize pattern-matches plotProActiveResults() FilteredOut: table containing contigs/chunks filtered small low read coverage Arguments: list object containing arguments used pattern-matching (windowSize, mode, chunkSize, chunkContigs) GeneAnnotTable: table containing gene annotations associated elevated gapped regions pattern-matches Save desired list item new variable using associated name. Metagenome results summary table: Subset genome results summary table: Subset GeneAnnotTable metagenome results:       Subset GeneAnnotTable genome results:

title: ProActive
text: plotProActiveResults() allows users visualize read coverage pattern-match associated Gap Elevation classification.

title: ProActive
text: ProActiveDetect() output contains information needed re-build pattern-match used classification. re-build complete pattern-match visualization, plotProActiveResults() uses pattern-match’s minimum maximum values start stop positions.

what: Plotting read coverage and associated pattern-matches
title: ProActive
text: default, read coverage plotted contig/chunk classified Gap Elevation read coverage. wish see read coverage noPattern classifications, sure set IncludeNoPatterns = TRUE running ProActiveDetect(). pattern-match associated classification overlaid coverage plot.

title: ProActive
text: Default arguments: Note- need set ‘genome’ ‘metagenome’ mode. plotProActiveResults() get information ProActiveDetect() output.
code: MetagenomeResultsPlots <- plotProActiveResults(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   ProActiveResults = ProActiveOutputMetagenome )  GenomeResultsPlots <- plotProActiveResults(   pileup = sampleGenomePileup,   ProActiveResults = ProActiveOutputGenome )

title: ProActive
text: pileup: .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. ProActiveResults: output ProActiveDetect(). elevFilter: Optional, plot results pattern-matches achieved elevation ratio (max/min) greater specified value. Default filter. saveFilesTo: Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results.

title: ProActive
text: output plotProActiveResults() list ggplot objects.

title: ProActive
text: Notice ‘chunk’ information plot titles

title: ProActive
text: geneAnnotationSearch() helps users explore gene annotations interest around detected gaps elevations read coverage.

title: ProActive
text: geneAnnotationSearch() utilizes .gff file pattern-matching results ProActiveDetect() locate gene annotations match provided keyWords. .gff file format described previously Input Files section vignette. First, information associated gene gene product (depending user selects geneOrProduct parameter) extracted attributes column .gff file. , .gff file subset include annotations associated contig/chunk assessed. , search can vary quite bit depending parameters user selects inGapOrElev bpRange parameters. inGapOrElev = FALSE (default), gene annotations located anywhere contig/chunk match one provided keyWords visualized. inGapOrElev = TRUE, gene annotations within gap/elevation region pattern-match searched matches provided keyWords. bpRange parameter can used inGapOrElev = TRUE allows search range extended specified number base pairs left right gap/elevation pattern-match borders. Gene annotation included search end open reading frame (defined ‘end’ values .gff file) falls within search region.

title: ProActive
text: read coverage locations gene annotations match provided keyWords visualized contig/chunk matches. read coverage plotted using 100 bp windowSize allow greater resolution read coverage patterns gene annotation locations. borders elevated/gapped regions read coverage detected ProActiveDetect() marked plot orange vertical lines. inElevOrGap = TRUE bpRange set non-zero value, extended search range outside gap/elevation borders marked plot orange dashed vertical lines. matching gene annotation locations marked plot black vertical lines start position associated open reading frames. Note- pattern-matching used identify borders elevated gapped regions read coverage likely performed using windowSize larger 100 bp ProActiveDetect(). means locations borders may perfectly translate borders gaps elevations 100 bp resolution.

title: ProActive
text: Default arguments: defaults, contigs/chunks classified gap elevation read coverage searched gene annotations match provided keywords. entire contig/chunk searched, just gapped elevated region. Non-default arguments following parameters/arguments, classified contigs/chunks searched gene annotations match provided keywords (default), use inGapOrElev = TRUE, gapped elevated region searched matching annotations. Additionally, use bpRange = 5000 means search region extended 5,000 bp left right gapped elevated region.
code: MetagenomeGeneMatches <- geneAnnotationSearch(   ProActiveResults = ProActiveOutputMetagenome,    pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,    gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV,    geneOrProduct = "product",    keyWords = c("transport", "chemotaxis")   ) #> Cleaning gff file... #> Cleaning pileup file... #> Searching for matching annotations... #> 3 contigs/chunks have gene annotations that match one or more of the provided keyWords GenomeGeneMatches <- geneAnnotationSearch(   ProActiveResults = ProActiveOutputGenome,   pileup =  sampleGenomePileup,    gffTSV = sampleGenomegffTSV,    geneOrProduct = "product",    keyWords = c("ribosomal"),    inGapOrElev = TRUE,    bpRange = 5000   ) #> Cleaning gff file... #> Cleaning pileup file... #> Searching for matching annotations... #> 8 contigs/chunks have gene annotations that match one or more of the provided keyWords

title: ProActive
text: ProActiveResults: output ProActiveDetect(). pileup: .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. gffTSV: .gff file (TSV) containing gene annotations associated .fasta file used generate pileup. geneOrProduct: “gene” “product”. Search keyWords associated genes gene products. keyWords: keyWord(s) search . Case independent. Searches return string #’ contains matching keyWord. KeyWord(s) must quotes, comma-separated, surrounded #’ c() .e( c(“antibiotic”, “resistance”, “drug”) ) inGapOrElev: TRUE FALSE. TRUE, search gene-annotations #’ gap/elevation region pattern-match. Default FALSE (.e search #’ entire contig/chunk gene annotation key-words) bpRange: inGapOrElev = TRUE, user may specify region (base pairs) #’ searched left right gap/elevation region. Default 0. elevFilter: Optional, plot results pattern-matches achieved elevation ratio (max/min) greater specified value. Default filter. saveFilesTo: Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results. verbose: TRUE FALSE. Print progress messages console. Default TRUE.
code: geneAnnotationSearch(   ProActiveResults,    pileup,    gffTSV,   geneOrProduct,    keyWords,    inGapOrElev = FALSE,   bpRange = 0,    elevFilter,    saveFilesTo,    verbose = TRUE   )

title: ProActive
text: output geneAnnotationSearch() list ggplot objects. Default search parameters:  Non-default search parameters (use inGapOrElev = TRUE bpRange = 5000)

what: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
text: ProActive automatically detects regions gapped elevated read coverage using 2D pattern-matching algorithm. ProActive detects, characterizes visualizes read coverage patterns genomes metagenomes. Optionally, users may provide gene annotations associated genome metagenome form .gff file. case, ProActive generate additional output table containing gene annotations found within detected regions gapped elevated read coverage. Additionally, users can search gene annotations interest output read coverage plots. Visualizing read coverage data important gaps elevations coverage can indicators variety biological non-biological scenarios, example- Elevations gaps read coverage may caused types structural variants. Deletions can cause gaps duplications can cause elevations read coverage [1]. Highly active /abundant mobile genetic elements, like transposable elements [2] prophage [3] example, can create elevations read coverage respective integration sites. Genetic regions high mutation rates /high variability within population can generate gaps read coverage [4]. Poor quality sequencing reads chimeric reference sequences may cause gaps elevations read coverage. Since cause gaps elevations read coverage can ambiguous, ProActive best used screening method identify genetic regions investigation tools! References: Tattini L., D’Aurizio R., & Magi . (2015). Detection Genomic Structural Variants Next-Generation Sequencing Data. Frontiers bioengineering biotechnology, 3, 92. https://doi.org/10.3389/fbioe.2015.00092 Kleiner M., Bushnell B., Sanderson K.E. et al. (2020) Transductomics: sequencing-based detection analysis transduced DNA pure cultures microbial communities. Visualizing contig coverages better understand microbial population structure. https://merenlab.org/2019/11/25/visualizing-coverages/

title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
text: ProActive detects read coverage patterns using pattern-matching algorithm operates pileup files. pileup file file format row summarizes ‘pileup’ reads specific genomic locations. Pileup files can used generate rolling mean read coverages associated base pair positions reduces data size preserving read coverage patterns. ProActive requires input pileups files generated using 100 bp window/bin size. Pileup files can generated mapping sequencing reads metagenome genome fasta. Read mapping performed using high minimum identity (0.97 higher) random mapping ambiguous reads. pileup files needed ProActive generated using .bam files produced read mapping. read mappers, like BBMap, allow generation pileup files bbmap.sh command use bincov output covbinsize=100 parameter/argument. Otherwise, BBMap’s pileup.sh can convert .bam files produced read mapper pileup files compatible ProActive using bincov output binsize=100. NOTE: detailed information input file format, please see vignette. Users may also use ‘sampleMetagenomePileup’ ‘sampleGenomePileup’ files come pre-loaded ProActive reference.

title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
text: ProActive optionally accepts .gff file input. .gff file must associated metagenome genome used create pileup file. .gff file TSV follow general format described .

title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
text: Install ProActive CRAN : Install development version ProActive GitHub :
code: install.packages("ProActive") library(ProActive) if (!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("devtools") }  devtools::install_github("jlmaier12/ProActive") library(ProActive)

title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
code: library(ProActive)   ## Metagenome mode  MetagenomeProActive <- ProActiveDetect(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   mode = "metagenome",   gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 2.09secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>         3         3         1  MetagenomePlots <- plotProActiveResults(pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,                                         ProActiveResults = MetagenomeProActive)  MetagenomeGeneMatches <- geneAnnotationSearch(ProActiveResults = MetagenomeProActive,                                                pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,                                                gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV,                                               geneOrProduct = "product",                                               keyWords = c("transport", "chemotaxis")) #> Cleaning gff file... #> Cleaning pileup file... #> Searching for matching annotations... #> 3 contigs/chunks have gene annotations that match one or more of the provided keyWords   ## Genome mode  GenomeProActive <- ProActiveDetect(   pileup = sampleGenomePileup,   mode = "genome",   gffTSV = sampleGenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 29.7secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>        25         3        21  GenomePlots <- plotProActiveResults(pileup = sampleGenomePileup,                                     ProActiveResults = GenomeProActive)  GenomeGeneMatches <- geneAnnotationSearch(ProActiveResults = GenomeProActive,                                            pileup = sampleGenomePileup,                                            gffTSV = sampleGenomegffTSV,                                           geneOrProduct = "product",                                           keyWords = c("ribosomal"),                                            inGapOrElev = TRUE,                                           bpRange = 5000) #> Cleaning gff file... #> Cleaning pileup file... #> Searching for matching annotations... #> 8 contigs/chunks have gene annotations that match one or more of the provided keyWords

title: Detect gene predictions in elevations and gaps — GPsInElevGaps
text: elevGapSummList list containing pattern-match information associated elevation gap classifications. (.e. NoPattern classifications) windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. gffTSV Optional, .gff file (TSV) containing gene predictions associated .fasta file used generate pileup. mode Either "genome" "metagenome" chunkContigs TRUE FALSE, TRUE `mode`="metagenome", contigs longer `chunkSize` 'chunked' smaller subsets pattern-matching performed subset. Default FALSE. chunkSize `mode`="genome" `mode`="metagenome" `chunkContigs`=TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching.

title: 'chunk' genomes — genomeChunks
text: Subset genome pileup chunks pattern-matching

title: 'chunk' genomes — genomeChunks
text: pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. chunkSize `mode`="genome" `mode`="metagenome" `chunkContigs`=TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching. `chunkSize` determines size (bp) 'chunk'. Default 50000.

title: ProActive — ProActive-package
text: `ProActive` automatically detects regions gapped elevated read coverage using 2D pattern-matching algorithm. `ProActive` detects, characterizes visualizes read coverage patterns genomes metagenomes. Optionally, users may provide gene annotations associated genome metagenome form .gff file. case, `ProActive` generate additional output table containing gene annotations found within detected regions gapped elevated read coverage. Additionally, users can search gene annotations interest output read coverage plots.

title: ProActive — ProActive-package
text: three main functions `ProActive` : ProActiveDetect performs pattern-matching characterization read coverage patterns. plotProActiveResults plots results  ProActiveDetect() geneAnnotationSearch searches classified contigs/chunks gene annotations match user-provided keywords.

title: ProActive — ProActive-package
text: Jessie Maier jlmaier@ncsu.edu

what: Detect elevations and gaps in mapped read coverage patterns. — ProActiveDetect
title: Detect elevations and gaps in mapped read coverage patterns. — ProActiveDetect
text: Performs read coverage pattern-matching summarizes results list.  first list item summarizes pattern-matching results. second list item 'cleaned' version summary table 'noPattern' classifications removed. (.e filtered ). third list item contains pattern-match information needed pattern-match visualization `plotProActiveResults()`. fourth list item table containing contigs filtered prior pattern-matching. fifth list item contains arguments used pattern-matching (windowSize, mode, chunkSize, chunkContigs). user provides gffTSV files, last list table consisting ORFs found within detected gaps elevations read coverage.

title: Detect elevations and gaps in mapped read coverage patterns. — ProActiveDetect
code: ProActiveDetect(   pileup,   mode,   gffTSV,   windowSize = 1000,   chunkContigs = FALSE,   minSize = 10000,   maxSize = Inf,   minContigLength = 30000,   chunkSize = 1e+05,   IncludeNoPatterns = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   saveFilesTo )

title: Detect elevations and gaps in mapped read coverage patterns. — ProActiveDetect
text: pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. mode Either "genome" "metagenome" gffTSV Optional, .gff file (TSV) containing gene predictions associated .fasta file used generate pileup. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. chunkContigs TRUE FALSE, TRUE `mode`="metagenome", contigs longer `chunkSize` 'chunked' smaller subsets pattern-matching performed subset. Default FALSE. minSize minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. maxSize maximum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default NA (.e. maximum). minContigLength minimum contig/chunk size (bp) perform pattern-matching . Default 25000. chunkSize `mode`="genome" `mode`="metagenome" `chunkContigs`=TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching. `chunkSize` determines size (bp) 'chunk'. Default 100000. IncludeNoPatterns TRUE FALSE, TRUE noPattern pattern-matches included ProActive PatternMatches output list. like visualize noPattern pattern-matches `plotProActiveResults()`, set TRUE. verbose TRUE FALSE. Print progress messages console. Default TRUE. saveFilesTo Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results.

title: Detect elevations and gaps in mapped read coverage patterns. — ProActiveDetect
text: list containing 6 objects described function description.

title: Detect elevations and gaps in mapped read coverage patterns. — ProActiveDetect
code: metagenome_results <- ProActiveDetect(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   mode = "metagenome",   gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 2.39secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>         3         3         1

Change the pileup window size — changewindowSize
text: pileupSubset subset pileup pertains contig/chunk currently assessed. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. mode Either "genome" "metagenome"

title: Summarizes pattern-matching results — classifSumm
text: Summarizes list pattern-matching classifications table.

title: Summarizes pattern-matching results — classifSumm
text: pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. bestMatchList list containing pattern-match information associated contigs/chunks classified `ProActive()` pattern-matching windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. mode Either "genome" "metagenome" chunkSize `mode`="genome" `mode`="metagenome" `chunkContigs`=TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching.

text: minCov minimum value pattern-match vector. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. maxCov maximum value pattern-match vector. elevLength Length elevated/gapped pattern-match region. nonElev Length non-elevated/gapped pattern-match region. bestMatchInfo information associated current best pattern-match contig/chunk assessed. pileupSubset subset pileup pertains contig/chunk currently assessed. minSize minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. elevOrGap Pattern-matching 'elevation' 'gap' pattern.

title: Gene annotation plot — geneAnnotationPlot
text: Plot read coverage location gene annotations match keywords search criteria contig/chunk currently assessed

title: Gene annotation plot — geneAnnotationPlot

title: Gene annotation plot — geneAnnotationPlot
text: geneAnnotSubset Subset gene annotations plotted keywords key-word(s) used search. pileupSubset subset pileup associated contig/chunk assessed colIdx column index 'gene' 'product' column startbpRange basepair search started 'specific' search used endbpRange basepair search ended 'specific' search used elevRatio maximum/minimum values pattern-match pattern pattern-match information associated contig/chunk assessed windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . chunkSize `mode`="genome" `mode`="metagenome" `chunkContigs`=TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching. `chunkSize` determines size (bp) 'chunk'. Default 50000. mode Either "genome" "metagenome"

what: Search for gene annotations on classified contigs/chunks — geneAnnotationSearch
title: Search for gene annotations on classified contigs/chunks — geneAnnotationSearch
text: Search contigs classified ProActive gene-annotations match provided key-word(s). Outputs read coverage plots contigs/chunks matching annotations.

title: Search for gene annotations on classified contigs/chunks — geneAnnotationSearch
code: geneAnnotationSearch(   ProActiveResults,   pileup,   gffTSV,   geneOrProduct,   keyWords,   inGapOrElev = FALSE,   bpRange = 0,   elevFilter,   saveFilesTo,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Search for gene annotations on classified contigs/chunks — geneAnnotationSearch
text: ProActiveResults output `ProActive()`. pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. gffTSV .gff file (TSV) containing gene predictions associated .fasta file used generate pileup. geneOrProduct "gene" "product". Search keyWords associated genes gene products. keyWords keyWord(s) search . Case independent. Searches return string contains matching keyWord. KeyWord(s) must quotes, comma-separated, surrounded c() .e( c("antibiotic", "resistance", "drug") ) inGapOrElev TRUE FALSE. TRUE, search gene-annotations gap/elevation region pattern-match. Default FALSE (.e search entire contig/chunk gene annotation key-words) bpRange `inGapOrElev` = TRUE, user may specify region (base pairs) searched left right gap/elevation region. Default 0. elevFilter Optional, plot results pattern-matches achieved elevation ratio (max/min) greater specified values. Default filter. saveFilesTo Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results. verbose TRUE FALSE. Print progress messages console. Default TRUE.

title: Search for gene annotations on classified contigs/chunks — geneAnnotationSearch
text: list ggplot objects

title: Search for gene annotations on classified contigs/chunks — geneAnnotationSearch
code: geneAnnotMatches <- geneAnnotationSearch(sampleMetagenomeResults, sampleMetagenomePileup,                                           sampleMetagenomegffTSV, geneOrProduct="product",                                           keyWords=c("toxin", "drug", "resistance", "phage")) #> Cleaning gff file... #> Cleaning pileup file... #> Searching for matching annotations... #> 2 contigs/chunks have gene annotations that match one or more of the provided keyWords

title: Controller function for pattern-matching — patternMatcher
text: pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . minSize minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. maxSize maximum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default NA (.e. maximum). mode Either "genome" "metagenome". minContigLength minimum contig/chunk size (bp) perform pattern-matching . Default 25000. verbose TRUE FALSE. Print progress messages console. Default TRUE.

title: Full elevation/gap pattern translator — patternTranslator
text: Translates full elevation/gap patterns across contigs/chunks 1000bp time. Translation stops elevation pattern 5000bp end contig/chunk.

title: Full elevation/gap pattern translator — patternTranslator
text: contigCov read coverages pertain pileupSubset bestMatchInfo information associated current best pattern-match contig/chunk assessed. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. pattern vector containing values associated pattern-match elevOrGap Pattern-matching 'elevation' 'gap' pattern.

title: sampleGenomePileup — sampleGenomePileup
text: <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25608871/>

title: sampleGenomePileup — sampleGenomePileup
text: dataset generated extracting DNA culture *Salmonella enterica* LT2 (LT2) infected phage P22. DNA shotgun sequenced Illumina (paired-end mode, 150 bp reads). sequencing reads mapped LT2 reference genome (NCBI RefSeq NC_003197.2). bbmap.sh bincov parameter covbinsize=100 used create pileup file 100 bp windows.

title: sampleGenomegffTSV — sampleGenomegffTSV
text: standard .gff file format. .gff file generated running PROKKA default parameters *Salmonella enterica* LT2 genome sequence  (NCBI RefSeq NC_003197.2) associated sampleGenomePileup ProActive package.

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup
text: subset contigs raw whole-community fraction read coverage pileup file generated read mapping. Report...

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup
text: ## `sampleMetagenomePileup` data frame 4,604 rows 4 columns: V1 Contig accession V2 Mapped read coverage averaged 100 bp window size V3 Starting position (bp) 100 bp window. Restarts 0  start new contig. V4 Starting position (bp) 100 bp window. restart  start new contig.

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup
text: <https://microbiomejournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s40168-020-00935-5>

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup
text: dataset generated conventional mouse fecal homogenate. whole-community extracted DNA sequenced Illumina (paired-end mode, 150 bp reads) metagenome assembled. sequencing reads mapped assembled contigs using BBMap. bbmap.sh bincov parameter covbinsize=100 used create pileup file 100 bp windows. subset 10 contigs pileup file selected sample dataset. contigs chosen associated read coverage patterns exemplify ProActive's pattern-matching characterization functionality across classifications: NODE_1911: elevation left NODE_1583: elevation right NODE_1884: gap right NODE_1255: gap left NODE_368: full gap NODE_617: elevation full NODE_1625: pattern

title: sampleMetagenomeResults — sampleMetagenomeResults
text: Output `ProActiveDetect()` Report...

title: sampleMetagenomeResults — sampleMetagenomeResults
text: ## `sampleMetagenomeResults` list 6 objects: SummaryTable table containing pattern-matching classifications CleanSummaryTable table containing gap elevation pattern-match classifications (.e. noPattern classifications removed) PatternMatches list object containing information needed visualize pattern-matches `plotProActiveResults()` FilteredOut table containing contigs/chunks filtered small low read coverage Arguments list object containing arguments used pattern-matching (windowSize, mode, chunkSize, chunkContigs) GeneAnnotTable table containing gene predictions associated elevated gapped regions pattern-matches

title: sampleMetagenomeResults — sampleMetagenomeResults
